IRS990.MissionDesc: THE BUSH GLOBAL HEALTH INITIATIVE, D/B/A PINK RIBBON RED RIBBON, IS AN INDEPENDENT AFFILIATE OF THE GEORGE W. BUSH INSTITUTE, AND COORDINATES ACTION TO SAVE WOMEN AND GIRLS' LIVES FROM CANCER IN COUNTRIES WHERE THE NEED IS GREATEST. BY WORKING WITH PUBLIC-AND PRIVATE-SECTOR ORGANIZATIONS, PINK RIBBON RED RIBBON BUILDS ON THE SUCCESS OF THE U.S. PRESIDENT'S EMERGENCY PLAN FOR AIDS RELIEF (PEPFAR), AND, WITH THE ONGOING COMMITMENT OF THE GEORGE W. BUSH INSTITUTE, DESIGNS AND IMPLEMENTS PROGRAMS FOR THE PREVENTION AND TREATMENT OF CERVICAL CANCER AND THE EARLY DETECTION AND TREATMENT OF BREAST CANCER.
IRS990.Desc: PINK RIBBON RED RIBBON IS A PUBLIC-PRIVATE PARTNERSHIP THAT LEADS COORDINATED ACTION TO SAVE LIVES FROM BREAST AND CERVICAL CANCER IN LOW-RESOURCE SETTINGS. THROUGH GREATER ACCESS TO PREVENTION AND TREATMENT, HEALTHY WOMEN STRENGTHEN FAMILIES, COMMUNITIES, AND NATIONS, DRIVING GLOBAL ECONOMIC GROWTH AND PROSPERITY.KEY ACHIEVEMENTS ACROSS ALL PRRR PROGRAMS FROM JANUARY TO MARCH 2018 INCLUDE: - PRRR PROGRAMS PROVIDED VIA SCREENING FOR CERVICAL CANCER FOR 9,293 WOMEN.- 675 OF THESE WOMEN WERE TREATED WITH CRYOTHERAPY OR LEEP FOR CERVICAL CANCER. (SEE SCHEDULE O FOR CONTINUATION)- A TOTAL OF 332 WOMEN WERE SCREENED FOR BREAST CANCER.AS A RESULT, SINCE INCEPTION, PRRR AND ITS PARTNERS HAVE: - SCREENED OVER HALF A MILLION WOMEN FOR CERVICAL CANCER IN BOTSWANA, ETHIOPIA, TANZANIA, AND ZAMBIA;- TREATED OVER 34,000 OF THESE WOMEN FOR PRE-CANCEROUS LESIONS; - VACCINATED ALMOST 150,000 GIRLS AGED 9 TO 13 AGAINST HPV THROUGH PILOT PROGRAMS AND DEMONSTRATION PROJECTS DESIGNED TO PAVE THE WAY FOR NATIONWIDE CAMPAIGNS; AND- SCREENED NEARLY 40,000 WOMEN FOR BREAST CANCER IN ETHIOPIA, TANZANIA, AND ZAMBIA. IN 2018, PINK RIBBON RED RIBBON DIRECTLY PROVIDED, OR WORKED WITH PARTNERS TO PROVIDE, THE FOLLOWING SERVICES:ZAMBIA:- PRRR AND PARTNERS CONTINUED TO SUPPORT ZAMBIA'S CERVICAL CANCER SCREENING AND TREATMENT PROGRAM.- PRRR CONTRIBUTED TO THE FINAL DRAFT OF THE SUSAN G. KOMEN-SPONSORED ROADMAP FOR BREAST CANCER CONTROL IN ZAMBIA.TANZANIA:- IN THE FIRST QUARTER OF 2018, PRRR SUPPORTED THE EVALUATION OF IMPLEMENTATION EFFORTS UNDER THE NATIONAL STRATEGIC PLAN OF 2011-2016. IN JUNE OF 2018, PRRR CONTRIBUTED TO THE DRAFT OF THE FINAL REPORT OF THE RESULTS OF THE "EVALUATION OF THE NATIONAL CERVICAL CANCER PREVENTION AND CONTROL PROGRAMME". - PRRR SUPPORTED THE DEVELOPMENT OF HARMONIZED TREATMENT PROTOCOLS FOR FEMALE INVASIVE CANCERS THAT WILL BE RELEASED IN MID-2018 AND WILL PROVIDE NATIONAL TREATMENT GUIDELINES, ENSURING THAT HOSPITALS ARE PROVIDING THE SAME MEDICINES AND TREATMENTS ACROSS THE SPECTRUM OF CARE.ETHIOPIA:- PRRR INITIATED AND LED AN EVALUATION OF IMPLEMENTATION EFFORTS IN PRRR-SUPPORTED SITES UNDER THE NATIONAL CANCER CONTROL PLAN OF 2016-2020. THE RESULTS OF THE EVALUATION WILL INFORM THE DEVELOPMENT OF THE SECOND FIVE-YEAR STRATEGY AND A BROADER AIM OF THE GOVERNMENT OF ETHIOPIA'S PLANS TO OPEN 1,500 SCREEN-AND-TREAT SITES.NAMIBIA:- PRRR AND PARTNERS ALSO PROVIDED SUPPORT TO THE MOHSS TO WRITE THE FIRST-EVER CERVICAL CANCER SERVICE DELIVERY GUIDELINES, WHICH WERE RELEASED IN QUARTER THREE OF 2018. OTHER PRRR ACCOMPLISHMENTS:- PINK RIBBON RED RIBBON WORKED WITH THE CDC FOUNDATION AND THE WORLD HEALTH ORGANIZATION TO HELP DEVELOP THE FIRST-EVER HARMONIZED TOOLKIT FOR MEASURING IMPACT AND OUTCOMES ACROSS COUNTRY CERVICAL CANCER PROGRAMS. THIS TOOLKIT - "IMPROVING DATA FOR DECISION-MAKING IN GLOBAL CERVICAL CANCER PROGRAMS" - WILL BE PUBLISHED IN QUARTER FOUR 2018.

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.ExplanationTxt: THE INFORMATION REPORTED IN THE 2018 COLUMN REPORTS THE ACTIVITY FOR THE SHORT PERIOD 1/1/2018-9/30/2018.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FOR THE YEAR ENDED SEPTEMBER 30, 2018, THE ORGANIZATION HAS DOCUMENTED ITS CONSIDERATION OF FASB ASC 740-10, INCOME TAXES, THAT PROVIDES GUIDANCE FOR REPORTING UNCERTAINTY IN INCOME TAXES AND HAS DETERMINED THAT NO MATERIAL UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS QUALIFY FOR EITHER RECOGNITION OR DISCLOSURE IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: GRANTS TO OUTSIDE ORGANIZATIONS ARE SUPPORTED BY WRITTEN AGREEMENTS THAT CLEARLY STATE THE PURPOSE OF THE GRANT. QUARTERLY PROGRESS AND FINANCIAL REPORTS ARE REQUIRED AND UNUSED GRANT FUNDS MUST BE REFUNDED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: $250,000 OF GARY EDSON'S 2018 REPORTABLE COMPENSATION IS RELATED TO 2017 SERVICES PROVIDED.

PERSON(S) INVOLVED: HOLLY KUZMICH IS THE SENIOR VICE PRESIDENT AND EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR OF THE GEORGE W. BUSH FOUNDATION WHICH IS A RELATED PARTY TO PINK RIBBON RED RIBBON. MS. KUZMICH ALSO SERVED ON THE BOARD OF PINK RIBBON RED RIBBON.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FORM 990 WAS PREPARED BY THE INDEPENDENT AUDIT FIRM, AND REVIEWED BY THE GEORGE W. BUSH FOUNDATION, A RELATED ORGANIZATION WHO RECEIVED ASSIGNMENT OF REMAINING PRRR GRANTS AND REMAINING ASSETS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: BOARD MEMBERS AND STAFF ARE REQUIRED TO SIGN A CONFLICT OF INTEREST ATTESTATION ANNUALLY. IDENTIFIED POTENTIAL CONFLICTS ARE REVIEWED AND BY THE APPOINTED BOARD COMMITTEE AND APPROPRIATE ACTIONS TOWARD RESOLUTION IDENTIFIED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD REVIEWS AND APPROVES ALL OFFICER COMPENSATION, INCLUDING THE CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER, THE CHIEF PROGRAM OFFICER, AND THE CHIEF FINANCE AND ADMINISTRATIVE OFFICER. THE BOARD USES COMPARABLE SALARY INFORMATION FROM SIMILAR EXEMPT ORGANIZATIONS IN DETERMINING COMPENSATION. THE DELIBERATION AND DECISION OF THE BOARD REVIEW IS DOCUMENTED IN THE MEETING MINUTES. THE MOST RECENT REVIEW TOOK PLACE IN DECEMBER 2017.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.

MS. HOLLY KUZMICH IS THE SENIOR VICE PRESIDENT AND EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR OF THE GEORGE W. BUSH FOUNDATION WHICH IS A RELATED PARTY TO PINK RIBBON RED RIBBON. MS. KUZMICH ALSO SERVES ON THE BOARD OF PINK RIBBON RED RIBBON. THE REQUIRED DISCLOSED REPORTABLE COMPENSATION IS PAID BY THE RELATED PARTY FOR TAX YEAR 2018. $250,000 OF GARY EDSON'S 2018 REPORTABLE COMPENSATION IS RELATED TO 2017 SERVICES PROVIDED.

IN 2017, PINK RIBBON RED RIBBON ASSESSED ITS ACCOMPLISHMENTS AND ITS ORGANIZATIONAL STRUCTURE. PRRR EMBARKED ON A COLLABORATIVE EFFORT WITH THE PRESIDENT'S EMERGENCY PLAN FOR AIDS RELIEF (PEPFAR) WHICH RESULTED IN A MODEL DEMONSTRATING GREATER IMPACT AND REDUCTION OF DEATHS DUE TO CERVICAL CANCER BY FOCUSING ON HIV-POSITIVE WOMEN, WHO HAVE A MUCH HIGHER RISK OF DEVELOPING CERVICAL CANCER. TO OPTIMIZE IMPLEMENTATION OF THIS BOLD NEW APPROACH, THE BUSH INSTITUTE ANNOUNCED IN MAY 2018 THAT THE GEORGE W. BUSH INSTITUTE, PEPFAR, AND UNAIDS FORMED THE NEXT PHASE OF THEIR PUBLIC-PRIVATE PARTNERSHIP CALLED THE PARTNERSHIP TO END AIDS AND CERVICAL CANCER. THIS PARTNERSHIP REFOCUSES PRRR'S ORIGINAL INTENTION OF ADDRESSING THE HIGHEST NEED -- THAT A WOMAN WHOSE LIFE HAS BEEN SAVED FROM AIDS SHOULD NOT DIE FROM A TREATABLE OR PREVENTABLE CANCER. TO BEST SUPPORT THE ACHIEVEMENT OF VIRTUALLY ELIMINATING DEATHS FROM CERVICAL CANCER AMONG HIV-POSITIVE WOMEN IN A GENERATION, THE WORK OF THE PARTNERSHIP TO END AIDS AND CERVICAL CANCER IS NOW BEING LED BY THE GEORGE W. BUSH INSTITUTE, PEPFAR, AND UNAIDS, AND PRRR CLOSED OPERATIONS AS A SEPARATE ENTITY IN 2018.
